<FILENAME>a2167876zex-10_21.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.21
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06DEN1157_6">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.21  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ky1158_forest_oil_corporation_amended__for03375"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ky1158_1"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>FOREST OIL CORPORATION<BR>  AMENDED AND RESTATED 2005 SALARY DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN    <BR>    <BR>    December&nbsp;31, 2004    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Purpose.  </B></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Forest Oil Corporation (the "Company") hereby amends and restates in its entirety the Forest Oil Amended and Restated 2005 Salary Deferred Compensation Plan (the
"Plan") for the purpose of providing the terms of an unfunded deferred compensation plan for a select group of management, highly compensated employees, directors and persons who have been management,
highly compensated employees or directors of Company who may elect, pursuant to the Deferral Elections, to defer certain compensation otherwise due to them. It is intended that the Plan constitute an
unfunded "top hat plan" for purposes of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended. The Plan will be administered and construed in accordance with Section&nbsp;409A of the Code
and any administrative guidance issued thereunder. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.  </B></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following terms used in the Plan shall have the meanings set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Affiliate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, with respect to the Company, any entity directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by, or under
common control with, the Company or any other entity designated by the Board in which the Company or an Affiliate has an interest. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Beneficiary</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean any person, persons, trust or other entity designated by a Participant to receive benefits, if
any, under the Plan upon such Participant's death. No designation or change in designation of a Beneficiary shall be effective until received and acknowledged in writing by the Committee or its
designated agent. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Board</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean the Board of Directors of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Change in Control</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean any of the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Change in Ownership.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any one person, or more than one person acting as a group (as defined in
Section&nbsp;2(d)(iv), below), acquires ownership of stock of the Company that, together with stock held by such person or group, constitutes more than 50% of the total fair market value or total
voting power of the stock of the Company. However, if any one person or more than one person acting as a group is considered to own more than 50% of the total fair market value or total voting power
of the stock of the Company, the acquisition of additional stock by the same person or persons shall not be considered to cause a change in the ownership of the Company (or to cause a change in the
effective control of the Company, within the meaning of Section&nbsp;2(d)(ii)). An increase in the percentage of stock owned by any one person, or persons acting as a group, as a result of a
transaction in which the Company acquires its stock in exchange for property will be treated as an acquisition of stock for this purpose. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Change in Effective Control.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Either (a)&nbsp;any one person, or more than one person acting as a group
(as determined under Section&nbsp;2(d)(iv)), acquires (or has acquired during the 12-month period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such person or persons) ownership
of stock of the Company possessing 35% or more of the total voting power of the stock of the Company, or (b)&nbsp;a majority of members of the Company's board of directors resigns or is otherwise
replaced during any 12-month period by directors whose appointment or election is not endorsed by a majority of the members of the Company's board of directors prior to the date of the
appointment or election; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Change in Ownership of a Substantial Portion of Assets.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any one person, or more than one person acting as
a group (as determined under Section&nbsp;2(d)(iv)), acquires (or has </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=37774,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_ky1158_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>acquired
during the 12-month period ending on the date of the most recent acquisition by such person or persons) assets from the Company that have a total gross fair market value equal to
or more than forty percent (40%) of the total gross fair market value of all of the assets of the Company immediately prior to such acquisition or acquisitions. For this purpose, gross fair market
value means the value of the assets of the Company, or the value of the assets being disposed of, determined without regard to any liabilities associated with such assets. However, there is no Change
in Control under this Section&nbsp;2(d)(iii)&nbsp;when there is a transfer to an entity that is controlled by the shareholders of the transferring corporation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Persons Acting as a Group.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the purposes of this Section&nbsp;2(d), persons will be not be considered
to be acting as a group solely because they purchase or own stock, or purchase assets, of the Company at the same time, or as a result of the same public offering. However, persons will be considered
to be acting as a group if they are the owners of a corporation that enters into a merger, consolidation, purchase or acquisition of stock or assets, or similar business transaction with the Company.
If a person, including an entity, owns stock in such a corporation and in the Company at a time that both of the Companies enter into a merger, consolidation, purchase or acquisition of stock or
assets, or similar transaction, such shareholder is considered to be acting as a group with other shareholders in a corporation only with respect to, and to the extent of, the ownership in that
corporation prior to the transaction giving rise to the change and not with respect to the ownership interest in the other corporation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Attribution.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For purposes of this Section&nbsp;2(d), the attribution rules of Section&nbsp;318 of the
Code shall apply to determine stock ownership. Stock underlying a vested option is considered owned by the individual who holds the vested option (and the stock underlying an unvested option shall not
be considered owned by the individual who holds the unvested option). For purposes of the preceding sentence, however, if a vested option is exercisable for stock that is not substantially vested (as
defined by Treasury Regulations Sections 1.83-3(b) and (j)), the stock underlying the option is not treated as owned by the individual who holds the option. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interpretation under Code Section&nbsp;409A.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The definition of Change in Control under this
Section&nbsp;2(d) is intended to comply with applicable definitions and requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(1)(B)(2)(v)&nbsp;and Internal Revenue Service Notice 2005-1, Q&amp;A
11-14, and proposed Treasury Regulations Section&nbsp;1.409A-3(g)(5), and shall be interpreted consistently therewith. Furthermore, to the extent that further Internal
Revenue Service guidance, including notices, rulings, regulations, etc., are issued subsequent to such Notice 2005-1 and proposed Treasury Regulations and modify the applicable change in
control event definitions and requirements, the definition herein of Change in Control shall be deemed to have been modified accordingly as of the effective date of such change as set forth in such
guidance. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Claimant</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;9(a). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Code</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Committee</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean the Compensation Committee appointed by the Board. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Company</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean Forest Oil Corporation, any successor to all or a major portion of the Company's assets or business
that assumes the obligations of the Company, and any other corporation or unincorporated trade or business that has adopted the Plan with the approval of the Company, and is a member of the same
controlled group of corporations or the same group of trades or businesses under common control (within the meaning of Code sections 414(b) and 414(c)) as the Company, or an affiliated service group
(as defined in Code section&nbsp;414(m)) which includes the Company, or any other entity required to be aggregated with the Company pursuant </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=396335,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_ky1158_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>to
regulations under Code sections 414(o) and 409A or any other affiliated entity that is designated by the Company as eligible to adopt the Plan.. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Deferral Account</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean the recordkeeping account established and maintained by the Company in the name of a
Participant as provided in Section&nbsp;4(b) for deferrals made by a Participant pursuant to a Deferral Election. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Deferral Amount</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean the amount of unvested restricted stock, compensatory options and/or cash compensation and
bonus amounts deferred pursuant to a Deferral Election; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however,</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that the Deferral Amount of each Participant on any given Deferral Election
shall be reasonably expected to result in a deferral of at least $10,000 or such other amount as the Committee shall specify from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Deferral Election</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean an election form executed by the Participant (as may be revised from time to time with
respect to any one or more Participants, consistent with the Plan, by or at the direction of the Company's president and chief executive officer, chief financial officer or chief legal officer),
whereby the Participant (i)&nbsp;makes an advance election to defer compensation such Participant would otherwise be entitled to receive with respect to unvested restricted stock, compensatory
options and/or in cash from the Company during the following calendar year, including an amount or percentage of compensation to be deferred, (ii)&nbsp;specifies a schedule according to which the
Participant will receive payout of his deferred compensation and (iii)&nbsp;makes such other elections as are permitted and provides such other information as is required under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(l)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Disabled</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" or "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Disability</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" refers to a Participant who: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is
unable to engage in any substantial gainful activity by reason of any medically determinable physical or mental impairment which can be expected to result in death or
can be expected to last for a continuous period of not less than 12&nbsp;months; or </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;is,
by reason of any medically determinable physical or mental impairment which can be expected to result in death or can be expected to last for a continuous period of
not less than 12&nbsp;months, receiving income replacement benefits for a period of not less than 3&nbsp;months under an accident and health plan covering employees of the Participant's employer. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
definition shall be construed and administered in accordance with the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(C). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(m)&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Election Date</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean December&nbsp;31, 2005. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(n)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Fair Market Value</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean, on a given date of valuation, (i)&nbsp;with respect to any mutual fund, the closing net
asset value as reported in The Wall Street Journal with respect to the date of valuation and (ii)&nbsp;with respect to a security traded on a national securities exchange or the NASDAQ National
Market, the closing price on the date of valuation as reported in The Wall Street Journal. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(o)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Hypothetical Investments</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;4(c). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(p)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Manager</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;4(c). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(q)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Observer</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;3(a). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(r)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Officers</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;8(b)(ii). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(s)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Participant</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean a present or former employee or director of the Company who is participating in this Plan and
any other present or former employee or director designated from time to time by the Committee. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=905424,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_ky1158_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(t)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Pay Day</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean, for each Participant, the day on which the Company is required, by the terms of the applicable
Deferral Election form or any other agreement between the Participant and the Company, to make a payment of cash or other compensation, which such Participant defers under this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(u)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Plan</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean this Forest Oil Corporation 2005 Salary Deferral Compensation Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Plan Effective Date</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean December&nbsp;31, 2004. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(w)&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Released Party</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;8(b)(iii). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(x)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Separation from Service</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the cessation of an Employee's service with the Company, other than by death or becoming
Disabled. This definition shall be construed and administered in accordance with the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(y)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Specified Employee</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a key employee, as described in Code Section&nbsp;416(i), without regard to
paragraph&nbsp;(5) thereof, of the Company for so long as any of its stock is publicly traded on an established securities market or otherwise. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
definition shall be construed and administered in accordance with the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(i). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(z)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Trust</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall mean any trust or trusts established or designated by the Company pursuant to Section&nbsp;5(a) to hold
assets in connection with the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(aa)&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Trustee</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;5(a). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(bb)&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>Unforeseeable Emergency</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a severe financial hardship to the Participant resulting from an illness or accident of
the Participant, the Participant's spouse, or a dependent (as defined in Code Section&nbsp;152(a)) of the Participant, loss of the Participant's property due to casualty, or other similar
extraordinary and unforeseeable circumstances arising as a result of events beyond the control of the Participant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
definition shall be construed and administered in accordance with the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A(a)(2)(B)(ii). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Authority and Administration of the Committee.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Authorization of Committee and Appointment of Observer.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Committee shall be authorized by the Board to administer the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Participants may, by a vote of the majority of the Participants, appoint a representative from among them (the "Observer") to observe all Committee meetings at
which the Committee will consider any material action or material change to the Plan or the Trust. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Committee Meetings.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall give ten (10)&nbsp;days' written notice to the Observer prior to
each Committee meeting (the "Notice") if such meeting considers any material action or material change to the Plan or Trust, which Notice may be waived in writing at any time by the Observer. The
Committee shall take all reasonable steps to schedule such a Committee meeting at a time when the Observer can attend. If the Observer is unable to attend the meeting, he or she may appoint a
substitute to attend. The Committee need not give Notice of a Committee meeting which does not consider material actions or material changes to the Plan or Trust. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=695131,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_ky1158_1_5"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Resignation and Removal.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Board shall provide the terms upon which members of the Committee serve on the Committee. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An
Observer shall be deemed to have resigned if he or she is no longer a Participant in the Plan, which deemed resignation shall be effective as of the date of
termination of participation in the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;A
majority of the Participants may remove an Observer, by giving thirty (30)&nbsp;days' written notice to the Observer. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Committee Voting.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided by the Board, in all matters pertaining to the administration
of the Plan, the concurrence and joinder of a majority of the Committee members shall be required at any time at which more than two (2)&nbsp;are acting, but if only two (2)&nbsp;are acting the
joinder of both of them shall be required. The Observer shall have no vote. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Committee Administration.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall administer the Plan in accordance with its terms, and shall
have all powers necessary to accomplish such purpose, including the power and authority to reasonably construe and interpret the Plan, to define the terms used herein, to prescribe, amend and rescind
rules and regulations, agreements, forms, and notices relating to the administration of the Plan, and to make all other determinations necessary or advisable for the administration of the Plan. The
senior human resources employee of the Company is initially appointed, on behalf of the Committee, to carry out purely administrative duties related to the Plan and to receive notices relating to the
Plan, and is hereby authorized to delegate such duties as he or she sees fit. The Committee may appoint additional agents and delegate thereto powers and duties under the Plan. All references to the
Committee in Section&nbsp;8(b) hereof shall be deemed to include any person acting on behalf of the Committee pursuant to this Section&nbsp;3(e). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participant Challenge of Committee Action.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There is no presumption that the Committee's actions or
interpretations with regard to the Plan are correct. Participants may, if approved by a vote of the majority of the Participants, challenge the Committee's actions and interpretations through
litigation or arbitration. The Company shall pay the costs and fees of any litigation or arbitration concerning the Plan if the Participants are successful. Additionally, the court or arbitrator may
award costs and fees to the Participants if the court or arbitrator finds the Participants' claim or action reasonable. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no such costs or fees of any Participant shall be
paid by the Company to the extent that the litigation or arbitration is connected with matters or issues which the Participants specifically waive under this Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferral Elections and Deferral Accounts.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferral Elections.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Participant may elect to defer all or a portion of his or her compensation, under
the terms provided in any Deferral Election form provided to the Participant in accordance with the Plan, by delivering to the Company a completed and executed Deferral Election on or before the
Election Date. The Deferral Election form shall establish for each Participant the type and amount of compensation (including unvested restricted stock and/or compensatory options) that may be
deferred
pursuant to the Plan and such determination will be reflected on the relevant Deferral Election form. The Company shall notify each Participant in writing of any upcoming Election Date applicable to
such Participant and shall solicit his or her Deferral Election to be delivered to the Company on or before that Election Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Code Section&nbsp;409A Transition Rules.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee, in its sole and absolute discretion, may offer to
any Participant the option to (i)&nbsp;terminate participation in the Plan and to receive in 2005 a complete payout of his or her Deferral Account, (ii)&nbsp;cancel deferral elections with respect
to compensation that would otherwise be payable in 2005, or (iii)&nbsp;make new elections in 2005 as to </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=96829,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_ky1158_1_6"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>time
and form of payment for compensation that would not otherwise be payable under the Plan in 2005, provided the elections are consistent with the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A. Any
elections made under this Section shall be administered by the Committee in accordance with Internal Revenue Service Notice 2005-1, proposed Treasury Regulations
&sect;1.409A-1 et seq. and any successor legislation or guidance that amends, supplements or replaces such guidance. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Establishment of Deferral Accounts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall establish a Deferral Account for each Deferral
Election timely delivered by a Participant. Each Deferral Account shall be maintained for the Participant solely as a bookkeeping entry by the Company to evidence unfunded obligations of the Company.
The Participant shall be 100% vested in the Participant's Deferral Account at all times, except to the extent otherwise specified in the applicable Deferral Election form. The balance in a Deferral
Account shall initially equal the Deferral Amount specified in the Participant's initial Deferral Election and shall be increased by the Deferral Amount specified in any subsequent Deferral Election
timely delivered by that Participant, in each case, less the amount of federal, state or local tax required by law to be withheld from the Deferral Amount. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hypothetical Investments and Managers.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the provisions of Section&nbsp;4(e), amounts credited to
a Deferral Account shall be deemed to be invested, at the Participant's direction from time to time, in a broad array of hypothetical investments selected from a list established by the Committee
("Hypothetical Investments") from time to time. A Participant may select Hypothetical Investments or may select an investment manager (a "Manager") from a list established by the Committee, and the
Manager will then select Hypothetical Investments on behalf of the Participant. Any Deferral Amount attributable to the deferral of compensation in connection with unvested restricted stock or
compensatory options shall be deemed to be invested initially in such stock or options, as the case may be. The Committee shall be liberal and shall include Hypothetical Investments and Managers
representing a wide variety of investment alternatives, and may include private equity securities that, in the judgment of the Company, (i)&nbsp;can be reasonably valued at least quarterly and
(ii)&nbsp;are transferable to accredited investors. The Committee shall consider requests from any Participant to add to the initial list of Hypothetical Investments and Managers and shall satisfy
such requests if they are reasonably acceptable to the Committee. The Committee may change or discontinue any Hypothetical Investment or Manager available under the Plan in its sole discretion. The
initial list of Hypothetical Investments and Managers shall be established by the Board or the Committee and provided to potential Participants in connection with the solicitation of the Deferral
Election. The initial list provided to a
Participant shall include as Hypothetical Investments any stock and compensatory options the Participant is permitted to defer under the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investment of Deferral Accounts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As provided in Section&nbsp;4(c), each Deferral Account shall be deemed
to be invested in one or more Hypothetical Investments as of the date of the deferral or credit, as the case may be. The amounts of hypothetical income, appreciation and depreciation in value of the
Hypothetical Investments shall be credited and debited to, or otherwise reflected in, such Deferral Account from time to time in accordance with procedures established by the Committee. Unless
otherwise determined by the Committee, amounts credited to a Deferral Account shall be deemed invested in Hypothetical Investments as of the date so credited. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Allocation and Reallocation of Hypothetical Investments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant may allocate and reallocate amounts
credited to his or her Deferral Account to one or more of the Hypothetical Investments or Managers authorized under the Plan. Subject to the rules established by the Committee, a Participant may
reallocate amounts credited to his or her Deferral Account to other Hypothetical Investments or other Managers by filing with the Committee a notice, in such form as may be specified by the Committee; </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2> that such reallocation shall not be permitted more </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=6,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=169875,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_ky1158_1_7"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>than
once per calendar quarter without the written consent of the Committee. The Committee may direct the Managers accordingly; provided, however, that a Manager may reallocate amounts credited to a
Deferral Account for which it has responsibility at any time without limitation. No Participant shall have the right, at any time, to direct a Manager to enter into specific transactions in connection
with his or her Deferral Account; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that this provision shall not prohibit the Participant from communicating with the Manager regarding
Hypothetical Investments, including communication regarding preferred Hypothetical Investment objectives. Each Manager shall have the power to acquire and dispose of such investments as the Manager
determines necessary in connection with its portfolio. The Committee may restrict or prohibit reallocation of amounts deemed invested in specified Hypothetical Investments or invested by specified
Managers to comply with applicable law or regulation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No Actual Investment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision of this Plan that may be interpreted to the
contrary, the Hypothetical Investments are to be used for measurement purposes only. A Participant's election of any such Hypothetical Investments, the allocation of such Hypothetical Investments to
his or her Deferral Account, the calculation of additional amounts and the crediting or debiting of such amounts to a Participant's Deferral Account shall not be considered or construed in any manner
as an actual investment of his or her Deferral Account in any such Hypothetical Investments. In the event that the Company or the Trustee, in its own discretion, decides to invest funds in any or all
of the Hypothetical Investments, no Participant shall have any rights in or to such investments themselves. Without limiting the foregoing, a Participant's Deferral Account shall at all times be a
bookkeeping entry only and shall not represent any investment made on his or her behalf by the Company or the Trust. The Participant shall at all times remain an unsecured creditor of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain Investments of the Trust.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company may, in its own discretion, take such actions as it deems
necessary and appropriate (including, where appropriate, establishing a separate trust pursuant to a separate trust agreement) in connection with any investment of the Trust in stock or options issued
by the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Establishment of Trust.  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Trust Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has entered into a Trust Agreement in the form attached hereto, providing
for the establishment of a trust to be held and administered by a trustee (the "Trustee") designated in the Trust Agreement (the "Trust"). The Trustee shall be the agent for the Committee for purposes
of (i)&nbsp;performing purely ministerial functions in connection with (A)&nbsp;maintaining the Deferral Accounts and (B)&nbsp;accepting and recording directions from a Participant as to the
allocation of amounts credited to the Participant's Deferral Account in accordance with Sections 4(c) and 4(e) and (ii)&nbsp;any other duties delegated to the Trustee by the Committee as set forth
in the Trust Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Funding the Trust.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Within five (5)&nbsp;business days after the relevant Pay Day, the Company shall
deposit into the Trust cash or other assets, as specified in the applicable Deferral Election, equal to the aggregate Deferral Amount of the Participant for that Pay Day, less applicable taxes. The
Company shall determine the procedures for transferring assets in respect of restricted stock or options deferred under the Plan. The assets of the Trust shall remain subject to the claims of the
general creditors of the Company in the event of an insolvency of the Company. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Taxes and Expenses of the Trust.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All taxes on any gains and losses from the investment of the assets of the
Trust shall be recognized by the Company and the taxes thereon shall be paid by the Company and shall not be recovered from the Deferral Accounts or the Trust. The third-party administrative and
investment expenses of the Plan and the Trust, including expenses charged by the Trustee to establish the Trust and the Trustee's annual fee per Deferral Account, shall be paid </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=7,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=978287,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_ky1158_1_8"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>by
the Trustee from the Trust and shall reduce each Deferral Account balance equally. Any expenses incurred with respect to a particular Hypothetical Investment shall be charged to the Deferral
Account that is deemed invested in such Hypothetical Investment. No part of the Company's internal expenses to administer the Plan, including overhead expenses, shall be charged to the Trust or the
Deferral Accounts. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Settlement of Deferral Accounts.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payout of Deferral Accounts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall pay or direct the Trustee to pay the net amount credited to a
Deferral Account as elected by the Participant in the Participant's Deferral Election. Except for payouts due to a Participant's death or becoming Disabled, no payout shall occur prior to the second
anniversary of the Plan Effective Date. Notwithstanding anything else in this Plan, all payouts shall occur on or prior to January&nbsp;1, 2011. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment in Cash.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall settle a Participant's Deferral Account, and discharge all of its
obligations to pay deferred compensation under the Plan with respect to such Deferral Account, by payment of cash in an amount equal to or, at the option of the Company, in marketable securities with
a Fair Market Value equal to the net amount credited to the applicable Deferral Account. Any such distributions to a Participant shall reduce the Company's obligations under the Plan to such
Participant. The Company's obligation under the Plan may be satisfied by distributions from the Trust. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Timing of Payments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments in settlement of a Deferral Account shall be made upon the earliest of the
following events: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Participant's becoming Disabled; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Participant's death; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;a
time or schedule specified in the Participant's Deferral Election form as provided in Section&nbsp;6(d) below; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
occurrence of an Unforeseeable Emergency (if requested by the Participant in accordance with Section&nbsp;6(h); </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a
Change in Control; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;&nbsp;the
Participant's Separation from Service (if elected by the Participant in the Participant's Deferral Election form); or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;January&nbsp;1,
2011. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Elections as to Time and Form of Payment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participants shall specify in their Deferral Election form, the
date on which payment of a Deferral Amount (and earnings thereon) is to commence, and the form of payment of the Deferral Amount (and earnings thereon). For each Deferral Amount, a Participant may
elect: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a
single lump-sum distribution to be made on a specified date no earlier than the second anniversary of the Plan Effective Date and no later than
January&nbsp;1, 2011; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;in
annual, semi-annual, or quarterly installments to begin on a specified date no earlier than the second anniversary of the Plan Effective Date and
continuing until a specified date no later than January&nbsp;1, 2011. Each installment payment shall equal the balance of the Participant's Account immediately prior to the installment, divided by
the number of installments remaining to be paid; provided however, that if a Participant dies after installment payments commence but before all payment have been made, all remaining amounts will be
paid to his or her beneficiary in a single lump sum no later than 60&nbsp;days after the death of the Participant. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=8,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=417496,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]KY1158A.;8',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_la1158_1_9"> </A> </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Distributions to Specified Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any payment elections made under Section&nbsp;6(d),
if the Committee determines that a Participant is a Specified Employee, distributions to such Participant as a result of Separation from Service may not commence before the date that is six
(6)&nbsp;months after the date of such Specified Employee's Separation from Service. In such event, the single lump sum payment or any installment payments that otherwise would have been payable
within such six (6)&nbsp;month period, as the case may be, will be paid as soon as administratively practicable after such six (6)&nbsp;month period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Default Elections.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant fails to specify the date on which payment of the deferred amount (and
earnings thereon) is to begin, the Participant will be deemed to have elected distribution upon Separation from Service in the form of a single lump sum. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Beneficiary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant dies prior to the complete distribution of his or her Deferral Account, the
balance of the Deferral Account shall be paid to the Participant's Beneficiary in a single lump-sum payment within 60&nbsp;days of the Participant's death. In the absence of an effective
Beneficiary designation as to part of all of a Participant's interest in the Plan, distribution shall be made to the Participant's surviving spouse, or, if none, to the executor or personal
representative of the Participant's estate. If the Committee has any doubt as to the proper Beneficiary to receive payments pursuant to this Plan, the Committee shall have the right, exercisable in
its discretion, to withhold such payment until this matter is resolved to the Committee's satisfaction. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unforeseeable Emergency.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant suffers an Unforeseeable Emergency, the Committee shall pay to the
Participant only that portion, if any, of his or her Deferral Account that the Committee determines to be necessary to satisfy the emergency need as determined by the Committee, including any amounts
necessary to pay any federal, state or local income taxes reasonably anticipated to result from the distribution. A Participant requesting a distribution under this Section&nbsp;6(h) shall apply for
the payment in a manner approved by the Committee and shall provide such additional information as the Committee may require. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Distribution upon Income Inclusion under Code Section&nbsp;409A.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If, for any reason, the Plan fails to
meet the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A and the regulations promulgated thereunder, the Committee shall distribute to the Participant the portion of the Participant's Deferral Account that
is required to be included in income as a result of the failure of the Plan to comply with the requirements of Code Section&nbsp;409A and the regulations promulgated thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effect on Deferral Account.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant's Deferral Account shall be debited to the extent of any
distributions to the Participant pursuant to this Section&nbsp;6. All amounts needed for a payment shall be deemed withdrawn from the Hypothetical Investments as close in time as is practicable to
the payment date. If a Participant has elected to receive partial payments of the amount in his or her Deferral Account, unpaid balances shall continue to be deemed to be invested in the Hypothetical
Investments such Participant has designated pursuant to Section&nbsp;4(c) or 4(e). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendment and Termination.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In General.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee, Plan Administrator or the Board may, with prospective or retroactive effect,
amend, alter, suspend, discontinue or terminate the Plan (i)&nbsp;if there is a change in law or regulatory authority that reasonably would be expected to result in an increase in the cost to the
Company of at least $1,000,000 to maintain the Plan (other than an increase resulting from taxes on any gains from investment of the assets of the Trust), (ii)&nbsp;if the Internal Revenue Service
determines that any amounts deferred under the Plan are includible in the Participant's gross income prior to being paid out to the Participant, (iii)&nbsp;any time during the calendar year 2005 or
2006 if determined to be necessary, appropriate or advisable in response to administrative </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>9</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=9,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=33166,FOLIO='9',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]LA1158A.;6',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_la1158_1_10"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>guidance
issued under Code Section&nbsp;409A or to comply with the provisions of Code Section&nbsp;409A, or (iv)&nbsp;no Participant is materially adversely affected by such action with respect
to amounts required to be credited to the Participant's Deferral Account under any previously executed Deferral Election; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided that,</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the Company may
accelerate distributions under this Plan only where doing so is consistent with Treasury Regulations and other guidance issued by the Internal Revenue Service under Code Section&nbsp;409A; and </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>provided further</I></FONT><FONT
SIZE=2> that, upon an event described in clause&nbsp;(i) or (ii)&nbsp;the Company may not, aside from any acceleration of benefits, alter
any Participant's rights under this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a termination under Section&nbsp;7(b) above, the Company shall also terminate
any other account balance nonqualified deferred compensation plans it maintains and shall not adopt a new account balance nonqualified deferred compensation plan within five (5)&nbsp;years from the
date of the termination. Upon such termination, the balance of the Participant's Deferral Account shall be distributed to the Participant no earlier than twelve (12)&nbsp;months after the
termination of the Plan and no later than twenty four (24)&nbsp;months after the termination of the Plan; provided however, amounts that would otherwise be payable under the terms of the Plan within
twelve (12)&nbsp;months of the termination of the Plan shall be distributed in accordance with the terms of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General Provisions.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Limits on Transfer of Awards.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other than by will, the laws of descent and distribution, or by appointing a
Beneficiary, no right, title or interest of any kind in the Plan shall be transferable or assignable by a Participant (or the Participant's Beneficiary) or be subject to alienation, anticipation,
encumbrance, garnishment, attachment, levy, execution or other legal or equitable process, nor subject to the debts, contracts, liabilities or engagements, or torts of any Participant or the
Participant's Beneficiary. Any attempt to alienate, sell, transfer, assign, pledge, garnish, attach or take any other action subject to legal or equitable process or encumber or dispose of any
interest in the Plan shall be void. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Waiver, Receipt and Release.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
between the Participant and the Company, a Participant and the Participant's Beneficiary shall assume all risk (other than gross negligence of the Company or the
Committee, or breach by the Company of the terms of this Plan) in connection with the Plan, Trust design, implementation or administration, Hypothetical Investment decisions made by the Participant
and the resulting value of the Participant's Deferral Account, the selection and actions of the Trustee or any other third party providing services to the Company or the Trust in connection with the
Plan or Trust (including their administrative and investment expenses), including any income tax issues of the Participant or Participant's Beneficiary relating to or arising out of his or her
participation in the Plan, and neither the Company nor the Committee shall be liable or responsible therefor other than as provided in Section&nbsp;5(c). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
a condition of being a Participant in the Plan, each Participant must sign a waiver releasing the Company and its Affiliates, the Committee, officers of the Company
or its Affiliates (the "Officers") and the Board from any claims and liabilities regarding the matters to which the Participant has assumed the risk as set forth in this Section. Payments (in any
form) to any Participant or Beneficiary in accordance with the provisions of the Plan shall, to the extent thereof, be in full satisfaction of all claims for compensation deferred and relating to the
Deferral Account to which the payments relate against the Company or any Affiliate or the Committee, and the Committee may require such Participant or Beneficiary, as a condition to such payments, to
execute a waiver, receipt and release to such effect. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>10</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=10,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=938143,FOLIO='10',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]LA1158A.;6',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_la1158_1_11"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;As
a condition of being a Participant in the Plan, each Participant must sign a waiver releasing the Trustee and each of its Affiliates (each, a "Released Party")
against any and all loss, claims, liability and expenses imposed on or incurred by any Released Party as a result of any acts taken or any failure to act by the Trustee, where such act or failure to
act is in accordance with the directions from the Committee or any designee of the Committee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Participant agrees to pay any taxes, penalties and interest such Participant or Beneficiary may incur in connection with his or her participation in this Plan, and
further agrees to indemnify the Company and its Affiliates, the Committee, Officers and the Board for such taxes, penalties and interest the Participant or Participant's Beneficiary incurs and fails
to pay and for which the Company is made liable by the appropriate tax authority. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unfunded Status of Awards, Creation of Trusts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan is intended to constitute an unfunded plan for
deferred compensation and each Participant shall rely solely on the unsecured promise of the Company for payment hereunder. With respect to any payment not yet made to a Participant under the Plan,
nothing contained in the Plan shall give a Participant any rights that are greater than those of a general unsecured creditor of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participant Rights.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No provision of the Plan or transaction hereunder shall confer upon any Participant any
right or impose upon any Participant any obligation to be employed by the Company or an Affiliate, or to interfere in any way with the right of the Company or an Affiliate to increase or decrease the
amount of any compensation payable to such Participant. Subject to the limitations set forth in Section&nbsp;8(c) hereof, the Plan shall inure to the benefit of, and be binding upon, the parties
hereto and their successors and assigns. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tax Withholding and Tax Forms.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall have the right to deduct from amounts otherwise credited to
or paid from a Deferral Account any sums that federal, state, local or foreign tax law requires to be withheld. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governing Law.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The validity, construction, and effect of the Plan and any rules and regulations relating to
the Plan shall be determined in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, without giving effect to principles of conflicts of laws to the extent not pre-empted by federal law. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Limitation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant and the Participant's Beneficiary shall assume all risk in connection with
(i)&nbsp;the performance of the Managers, (ii)&nbsp;the performance of the Hypothetical Investments and (iii)&nbsp;the tax treatment of amounts deferred under or paid pursuant to the Plan, and
neither the Company nor the Committee shall be liable or responsible therefor. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Construction.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The captions and numbers preceding the sections of the Plan are included solely as a matter of
convenience of reference and are not to be taken as limiting or extending the meaning of any of the terms and provisions of the Plan. Whenever appropriate, words used in the singular shall include the
plural or the plural may be read as the singular. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that any provision of the Plan shall be declared illegal or invalid for any
reason, said illegality or invalidity shall not affect the remaining provisions of the Plan but shall be fully severable, and the Plan shall be construed and enforced as if said illegal or invalid
provision had never been inserted herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Status.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The establishment and maintenance of, or allocations and credits to, the Deferral Account of any
Participant shall not vest in any Participant any right, title or interest in or to any Plan or Company assets or benefits except at the time or times and upon the terms and conditions and to the
extent expressly set forth in the Plan and in accordance with the terms of any Trust. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Spouse's Interest.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The interest in the benefits hereunder of a spouse of a Participant who has predeceased
the Participant shall automatically pass to the Participant and shall not be </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>11</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=11,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=24586,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]LA1158A.;6',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_la1158_1_12"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>transferable
by such spouse in any manner, including but not limited to such spouse's will, nor shall such interest pass under the laws of intestate succession. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(l)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Successors.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The provisions of the Plan shall bind the Company and its successors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Claims Procedures.  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Presentation of Claim.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Participant or Beneficiary of a deceased Participant (such Participant or
Beneficiary being referred to below as a "Claimant") may deliver to the Committee a written claim for a determination with respect to the amounts distributable to such Claimant from the Plan. If such
a claim relates to the contents of a notice received by the Claimant, the claim must be made within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after such notice was received by the Claimant. All other claims must be made
within one hundred eighty (180)&nbsp;days of the date on which the event that caused the claim to arise occurred. The claim must state with particularity the determination desired by the Claimant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notification of Decision.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall consider a Claimant's claim within ten (10)&nbsp;days of
receipt of the claim and shall notify the Claimant in writing: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that
the Claimant's requested determination has been made, and that the claim has been allowed in full; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that
the Committee has reached a conclusion contrary, in whole or in part, to the Claimant's requested determination, and such notice must set forth in a manner
reasonably believed to be understood by the Claimant: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;&nbsp;a
specific reason or reasons the claim was denied; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;&nbsp;specific
reference(s) to the pertinent Plan provisions upon which the decision was based; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;&nbsp;a
description of any additional material or information necessary for the Claimant to perfect the claim, and an explanation of why such material or information is
necessary; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D)&nbsp;&nbsp;an
explanation of the claim review procedure set forth below. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Review of a Denied Claim.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Within sixty (60)&nbsp;days (180&nbsp;days for a Disability claim) after
receiving a notice from the Committee that a claim has been denied in whole or in part, a Claimant (or the Claimant's duly authorized representative) may file with the Committee a written request for
a review of the denial of the claim. Thereafter, but not later than thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the request for the review is filed, the Claimant (or the Claimant's duly authorized representative): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;May,
upon reasonable request and free of charge, have reasonable access to, and copies of, all pertinent documents, records and other information in the Company's
possession; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will
be informed of such other matters as the Committee deems relevant. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Committee shall conduct a full and fair review of the claim and the initial adverse benefit determination and notify the Claimant in writing of its decision within sixty (60)&nbsp;days
(45&nbsp;days for a Disability claim) after receipt of Claimant's request for a review. In the case of an adverse benefit determination, the notification shall set forth (1)&nbsp;the specific
reason or reasons for the adverse determination, (2)&nbsp;reference to the specific Plan provisions on which the determination is based, (3)&nbsp;a statement that the Claimant is entitled to
receive, upon request and free of charge, reasonable access to, and copies of, all documents, records, and other information relevant to the Claimant's claim for </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>12</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=12,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="6",CHK=818317,FOLIO='12',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]LA1158A.;6',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:41' -->
<A NAME="page_la1158_1_13"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>benefits,
and (4)&nbsp;a statement describing the right to bring an action under Section&nbsp;502(a) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Legal Action.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Claimant's compliance with the foregoing provisions of this Article&nbsp;9 is a mandatory
prerequisite to a Claimant's right to commence any legal action with respect to any claim for benefits under this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> 10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective Date.  </B></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall be effective as of the Plan Effective Date. </FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.22
<TEXT>
<HTML>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06DEN1157_7">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.22  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="lc1158_first_amendment_to_the_forest___fir04068"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_lc1158_1"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>FIRST AMENDMENT<BR>  TO THE<BR>  FOREST OIL CORPORATION AMENDED AND RESTATED<BR>  SALARY DEFERRAL COMPENSATION PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, Section&nbsp;9 of the Forest Oil Corporation Amended and Restated Salary Deferral Compensation Plan is hereby amended
by deleting Section&nbsp;9 in its entirety and substituting it with the following: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B> "9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Claims Procedures.  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Presentation of Claim.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Participant or Beneficiary of a deceased Participant (such Participant or
Beneficiary being referred to below as a "Claimant") may deliver to the Committee a written claim for a determination with respect to the amounts distributable to such Claimant from the Plan. If such
a claim relates to the contents of a notice received by the Claimant, the claim must be made within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after such notice was received by the Claimant. All other claims must be made
within one hundred eighty (180)&nbsp;days of the date on which the event that caused the claim to arise occurred. The claim must state with particularity the determination desired by the Claimant. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notification of Decision.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall consider a Claimant's claim within ten (10)&nbsp;days of
receipt of the claim and shall notify the Claimant in writing: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that
the Claimant's requested determination has been made, and that the claim has been allowed in full; or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;that
the Committee has reached a conclusion contrary, in whole or in part, to the Claimant's requested determination, and such notice must set forth in a manner
reasonably believed to be understood by the Claimant: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;&nbsp;a
specific reason or reasons the claim was denied; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;&nbsp;specific
reference(s) to the pertinent Plan provisions upon which the decision was based; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;&nbsp;a
description of any additional material or information necessary for the Claimant to perfect the claim, and an explanation of why such material or information is
necessary; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D)&nbsp;&nbsp;an
explanation of the claim review procedure set forth below. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Review of a Denied Claim.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Within sixty (60)&nbsp;days (180&nbsp;days for a Disability claim) after
receiving a notice from the Committee that a claim has been denied in whole or in part, a Claimant (or the Claimant's duly authorized representative) may file with the Committee a written request for
a review of the denial of the claim. Thereafter, but not later than thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the request for the review is filed, the Claimant (or the Claimant's duly authorized representative): </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;May,
upon reasonable request and free of charge, have reasonable access to, and copies of, all pertinent documents, records and other information in the Company's
possession; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;will
be informed of such other matters as the Committee deems relevant. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Committee shall conduct a full and fair review of the claim and the initial adverse benefit determination and notify the Claimant in writing of its decision within sixty (60)&nbsp;days
(45&nbsp;days for a Disability claim) after receipt of Claimant's request for a review. In the case of an adverse benefit determination, the notification shall set forth (1)&nbsp;the specific
reason or reasons for the adverse determination, (2)&nbsp;reference to the specific Plan provisions on which the determination is based, (3)&nbsp;a statement that the Claimant is entitled to
receive, upon request and free of charge, reasonable access </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2167876",CP="FOREST OIL CORPORATION",DN="7",CHK=179952,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK129:[06DEN8.06DEN1158]LC1158A.;4',USER='DTAYLOR',CD='14-MAR-2006;12:42' -->
<A NAME="page_lc1158_1_2"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>to,
and copies of, all documents, records, and other information relevant to the Claimant's claim for benefits, and (4)&nbsp;a statement describing the right to bring an action under
Section&nbsp;502(a) of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Legal Action.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Claimant's compliance with the foregoing provisions of this Article&nbsp;9 is a mandatory
prerequisite to a Claimant's right to commence any legal action with respect to any claim for benefits under this Plan." </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the undersigned has caused this amendment to be executed the 20th day of December, 2005. </FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.27
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#06DEN1157_8">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="le1158_third_amendment_to_forest_oil___thi03221"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_le1158_1"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>THIRD AMENDMENT TO<BR>  FOREST OIL CORPORATION<BR>  EXECUTIVE DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Forest Oil Corporation (the "Company") has heretofore adopted the Forest Oil Corporation Executive
Deferred Compensation Plan, as amended pursuant to a First Amendment dated November&nbsp;13 ,2002 and a Second Amendment dated February&nbsp;3, 2003 (as so amended, the "Plan"); and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, pursuant to Section&nbsp;10.4 of the Plan the Committee desires to amend Section&nbsp;3.3 of the Plan, Earnings Credits, to
decrease the monthly earnings credit percent from 1% to one-half of 1% per month commencing January&nbsp;1, 2006; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the Plan shall be amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
as of January&nbsp;1, 2006: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;3.3
of the the Plan, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Earnings Credit</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, shall be amended by deleting the reference to "1%" included in the first sentence
and replacing it with "one-half of 1%". </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;II.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
amended hereby, the Plan is specifically ratified and reaffirmed in all respects. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> the undersigned has caused these presents to be executed the 20th day of December, 2005. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>The Board of Directors<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Forest Oil Corporation: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
consent to the incorporation by reference in (i)&nbsp;the Registration Statements (Nos. 2-74151, 2-76946, 33-02748 and </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>33-59504)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Forest Oil Corporation&#151;Retirement Savings Plan
of Forest Oil Corporation,
(ii)&nbsp;the Registration Statement (No.&nbsp;33-48440) on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Forest Oil Corporation&#151;1992 Stock Option Plan of Forest Oil Corporation,
(iii)&nbsp;the Registration Statement (No.&nbsp;333-49376) on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Forest Oil Corporation&#151;Forcenergy 1999 Stock Plan filed as Post Effective
Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to the Registration Statement of Forest Oil Corporation on Form&nbsp;S-4, (iv)&nbsp;the Registration Statement (No.&nbsp;333-117388) on
Form&nbsp;S-3 of Forest Oil Corporation, (v)&nbsp;the Registration Statements (Nos. 333-05497 and 333-89174) on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Forest Oil
Corporation&#151;Stock Incentive Plan, (vi)&nbsp;the Registration Statement (Nos. 333-81529 and 333-127873) on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Forest Oil
Corporation&#151;Employee Stock Purchase Plan, (vii)&nbsp;the Registration Statements (Nos. 333-62408 and 333-108267) on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Forest Oil
Corporation&#151;2001 Stock Incentive Plan, and (viii)&nbsp;the Registration Statement (No.&nbsp;333-108271) on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Forest Oil
Corporation&#151;Employee Benefit Plan, of our report dated March&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2006 with respect to the consolidated balance sheets of Forest Oil Corporation and subsidiaries as of
December&nbsp;31, 2005 and 2004, and the related consolidated statements of operations, shareholders' equity, and cash flows for each of the&nbsp;years in the three-year period ended
December&nbsp;31, 2005, management's assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, and the effectiveness of internal control over
financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2005, which reports appear in the December&nbsp;31, 2005 annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Forest Oil Corporation. Our report on the
consolidated financial statements refers to the adoption of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;143. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
